p.ph: A host / super user account. Hosts have full permissions to all sites in the DNN instance.
A host account is required to upload modules and themes, because they might contain executable code. (An administrator account is sufficient to apply modules and themes to a website.)
An administrator account for the site. Administrators have full permissions to the specific site.
The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in RFC 2119.

body.p:
Thousands of third-party modules and themes are available from these sources:
DNN Store: Extensions for sale. Some developers provide versions that include the source code.
DNN Forge: Open source and free extensions.
body.note: 10 Pound Gorilla's Skinning Tool is both a reference and a tool that customizes the code for DNN theme objects, based on the attribute values you specify.

ul.li: The page is published after the specified start date. If Start Date is not set, the page is published immediately.
The page is hidden after the specified end date. If End Date is not set, the page is visible indefinitely.
None creates a new page and adds it to the site's navigation.
URL creates a navigation link to an external resource outside the site. Add a new URL in Location or select from the dropdown list of previously entered URLs.
Page creates a navigation link to a page in the same site. Choose the page from the Page dropdown.
File creates a navigation link to a file in the same site. Choose a file that is already on your site or upload a file.

To choose a file that is already on your site,
Select File (A File on Your Site).
Choose the Folder where the file can be found.
Choose the File.

To upload a file to your site,
Choose the Folder where the file should be stored.
Drag and drop the files from your local drive to the Drop File(s) Here box.
Click/Tap Upload File.

p.ph: This is the old term, still used in some APIs and UI controls.

body.note: If your Evoq instance is hosted on the DNN Cloud, please contact Customer Support directly. The following instructions are not applicable to DNN Cloud instances.
body.codeblock: <authServices> <messageHandlers> <!-- other message handlers --> <add name="JWTAuth" type="Dnn.AuthServices.Jwt.Auth.JwtAuthMessageHandler, Dnn.AuthServices.Jwt" enabled="false" defaultInclude="false" forceSSL="true"/> </messageHandlers> </authServices>
